question: Who had a wife and one son?
answer1: Odshedoph

question: Where did Odshedoph withdraw his family to?
answer1: the neighborhood of a distant forest, where game abounded

question: What did the wife do while the husband went out to hunt?
answer1: fixed the lodge

question: Why was the son afraid to go to the river for some water?
answer1: It was dark.

question: What happened to the stripling after his father said the stripling would never kill the Red Head?
answer1: He mused in silence. He sat by the lodge door all the night through, looking up at the stars, and sighing like one sorely distressed.
answer2: He refused to eat, and made no reply when spoken to.

question: Why did Strong Desire run out of arrows?
answer1: left the arrows in the carcasses

question: Why did Strong Desire throw himself upon the earth in despair?
answer1: He was in great distress at night for the want of food.

question: What did Strong Desire discover at a distance?
answer1: the figure of a human being

question: Who did Strong Desire discover the figure as?
answer1: the terrible witch
answer2: the little old woman who makes war

question: What happened after the witch shook her mantle several times?
answer1: The scalps uttered loud shouts of laughter.

question: What did the witch tell Strong Desire?
answer1: She had known him from the time he had left his father's lodge, and had watched his movements.
answer2: She told him not to fear or despair, for she would be his protector and friend.

question: What did the witch do to Strong Desire?
answer1: dressed him as a female, furnishing him with the necessary garments, and tinting his face with colors of the most charming dye
answer2: took a great leaden comb and drew it through his locks several times
answer3: gave him a bowl of shining metal

question: Who was the terror of all the country?
answer1: Hah-Undo-Tah, or the Red Head

question: Where did Red Head live?
answer1: upon an island in the centre of his realm of water

question: What would happen if Red Head did not seek Strong Desire?
answer1: She would return to her village.

question: What did the witch tell Strong Desire to do once he reached a lonesome spot with Red Head?
answer1: cut off Red Head's head with the blade of grass

question: Why did Strong Desire decline the proposals of marriage?
answer1: He was a man.
answer2: He did not want to marry.
answer3: He only wanted to kill Red Head.

question: What did Red Head do to pacify the rattlesnakes?
answer1: spoke to them

question: Why was the mother of the Red Head fixated on her new daughter-in-law?
answer1: The figure and manners, the countenance, and more especially the eyes, were beyond a doubt those of a man.

question: What did Red Head's father do when Red Head's mother urged her doubts?
answer1: broke his pipe-stem in her face and called her an owl

question: Why did the mock bride inform the Red Head she should return to her own friends?
answer1: She received so gross an affront from his relatives she could not think of remaining with him as his wife.

question: What happened to Strong Desire's manner after Red Head rested his head on Strong Desire's lap?
answer1: Strong Desire now changed his manner, was very kind and soothing.

question: What did Strong Desire see when he looked back?
answer1: the torches of persons come out in search of the new married couple

question: How did the witch feel when she received Strong Desire?
answer1: rejoice

question: Who required an offering or sacrifice from all of her sons who performed extraordinary deeds?
answer1: Maunkahkeesh, the Spirit of the Earth

question: What did the little old woman give Strong Desire to throw into the opening?
answer1: a partridge

question: What did Strong Desire find his parents doing?
answer1: The parents were in heavy sorrowing for their son, whom they supposed to be lost.

question: How will the young men feel when they saw the head of the Red Sorcerer?
answer1: scared

question: Why did the young men believe Strong Desire was mad?
answer1: They did not believe that Strong Desire could kill Red Head.
answer2: Strong Desire feared walking at night.

question: Why did Strong Desire busy himself in preparing a bow and arrows?
answer1: to hunt

question: Why will the Indians want to make Strong Desire their wife?
answer1: Strong Desire appears to be a woman.
answer2: Strong Desire has a shining bowl.
answer3: Strong Desire is beautiful and mysterious.

question: How will Red Head feel marrying Strong Desire?
answer1: lucky

question: Why did Red Head not want to kill Strong Desire?
answer1: Strong Desire was beautiful.
answer2: Red Head did not want to kill family members.

question: Why was Strong Desire afraid of the dark?
answer1: He could not see.

question: Why was Strong Desire placed among the first warriors of the nation?
answer1: Strong Desire overcame his fear.
answer3: Strong Desire proved himself brave with Red Head's head.

question: Why did Red Head want to marry Strong Desire?
answer1: Strong Desire rejected everyone's proposals.

question: How will Red Head be able to focus on massacre after marrying Strong Desire?
answer1: no longer worry about marriage
answer3: have free time since his wife will be caring for him
